  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath2 be a closed riemannian manifold , and @xmath3 be a diffeomorphism .",
    "we say @xmath0 is transitive , if for any two open sets @xmath4 , there exists @xmath5 , such that @xmath6 .",
    "transitivity is a notion to describe the mixing property of the dynamics generated by @xmath0 .",
    "the transitivity of @xmath0 is equivalent to there exists a point @xmath7 whose positive orbit @xmath8 is dense in @xmath2 .",
    "we call a point @xmath9 is a non - wandering point of @xmath0 , if for any neighborhood @xmath10 of @xmath7 , there exists @xmath5 , such that @xmath11 .",
    "the non - wandering set @xmath12 is the set of all non - wandering points of @xmath0 .",
    "it is clear that a point is a non - wandering point , then its orbit has somekind recurrent property .    for two points @xmath13 ,",
    "we say @xmath14 is chain attainable from @xmath7 , if for any @xmath15 , there exists a finite sequence @xmath16 with @xmath17 and @xmath18 , such that @xmath19 for any @xmath20 .",
    "a point @xmath9 is called a chain recurrent point , if it is chain attainable from itself .",
    "the set of chain recurrent points is called chain recurrent set of @xmath0 , denoted by @xmath21 .",
    "if every point is chain recurrent , we say @xmath0 is chain transitive .    it is clear that if a point is non - wandering , then it must be chain recurrent .",
    "similarly , if @xmath0 is transitive , then it must be chain transitive .",
    "however , from the powerful chain connecting lemma @xcite , there exists a residual set @xmath22 , such that for any @xmath23 , we have @xmath24 .",
    "moreover , for the classical anosov diffeomorphisms , we must have their non - wandering sets are equal to chain recurrent sets .",
    "a diffeomorphism @xmath3 is partially hyperbolic , if the tangent bundle @xmath25 splits into three nontrivial @xmath26-invariant bundles @xmath27 , such that @xmath28 is uniformly contracting , @xmath29 is uniformly expanding , and @xmath30 lies between them : @xmath31 it is known that there are unique @xmath0-invariant foliations @xmath32 and @xmath33 tangent to @xmath34 and @xmath35 respectively .",
    "an important geometric property of partially hyperbolic diffeomorphisms is accessibility .",
    "a partially hyperbolic diffeomorphism @xmath0 is accessible , if for any two pints @xmath13 , they can be joined by an arc consisting of finitely many segments contained in the leaves of foliations @xmath32 and @xmath33 .",
    "accessibility plays a key role for proving the ergodicity of partially hyperbolic diffeomorphisms , see @xcite .",
    "moreover , it has been observed that most of partially hyperbolic diffeomorphisms are accessible @xcite .",
    "m. brin @xcite has proved that for a partially hyperbolic diffeomorphism @xmath3 , if @xmath0 is accessible and @xmath36 , then @xmath0 is transitive .",
    "see also @xcite .",
    "so it is natural to ask the following question : _ if a partially hyperbolic diffeomorphism @xmath0 is accessible and @xmath37 , is @xmath0 transitive ? _ in this paper , we construct an example which gives a negative answer to this question .",
    "this implies brin s result could not be generalized for the case where @xmath37 .",
    "let @xmath38 be a hyperbolic automorphism over @xmath39 .",
    "we say @xmath40 is a partially hyperbolic skew - product over @xmath41 , if for every @xmath42 , we have @xmath43 we will consider @xmath44 , and usually use the coordinate @xmath45/\\{-1,1\\}$ ] .",
    "our main result is the following theorem .",
    "[ main ] there exists a partially hyperbolic skew - product @xmath46-diffeomorphism @xmath40 , such that @xmath0 is accessible and chain transitive , but not transitive .",
    "we want to point out that for @xmath47-generic diffeomorphisms , chain transitivity implies transitivity .",
    "our construction need the help of nonhyperbolic periodic points .",
    "so we do nt know for @xmath48-generic or @xmath48-open dense accessible partially hyperbolic diffeomorphisms , whether chain transitivity implies transitivity .",
    "the idea of our example is first we construct a chain transitive partially hyperbolic skew - product diffeomorphism on @xmath49 , such that its non - wandering set is not the whole @xmath49 and not transitive .",
    "then we make a small perturbation to achieve the accessibility , and still preserving the dynamical properties .",
    "first we need a diffeomorphism on @xmath50 that is chain transitive but the non - wandering set is not the whole circle .    let @xmath51 be defined as @xmath52 it is a @xmath46-smooth function on @xmath50 .",
    "we can see that @xmath53 on @xmath50 , and has two zero points @xmath54 and @xmath55 .",
    "the vector field @xmath56 is a smooth vector field on @xmath50 , and its time-@xmath57 map for @xmath58 is the diffeomorphism we need on the circle .",
    "see figure 1 . that is the time-@xmath57 map of @xmath59 is chain transitive , and the non - wandering set consists of only two fixed points @xmath54 and @xmath55",
    ". using the product structure , we can define it on @xmath60 .",
    "the vector field @xmath61 defined by @xmath62 is a smooth vector field on @xmath49 .",

    "we want to point out that @xmath64 and @xmath92 are commutable , thus @xmath93 .",
    "now @xmath78 is a chain transitive but nontransitive partially hyperbolic diffeomorphism on @xmath49 .",
    "however , @xmath78 is not accessible , since the union of stable and unstable bundles of @xmath78 is integrable .",
    "we will make some more perturbations to achieve the accessibility , and preserving other dynamical properties .",
    "let @xmath94 be the fixed point of the linear anosov automorphism @xmath41 .",

    "now we can proof the main theorem from the following three lemmas .      from the first and second properties of @xmath0 in proposition [ prop : property ] ,",
    "we know that @xmath0 is a partially hyperbolic skew - product diffeomorphism on @xmath49 , thus the stable and unstable manifolds of the fixed fiber @xmath84 are dense on @xmath49 . since @xmath134 is chain transitive , this implies @xmath0 is chain transitive on @xmath49 .",
    "since @xmath0 is a partially hyperbolic skew - product diffeomorphism on @xmath49 , if @xmath0 is not accessible , then from theorem 1.6 of @xcite , @xmath0 has a compact @xmath146-leaf . here",
    "@xmath146-leaf is a compact complete 2-dimensional submanifold which is tangent to @xmath147 of @xmath0 .",
    "it is a torus transverse to the @xmath50-fiber of @xmath49 .",
    "since the compact @xmath146-leaf is saturated by @xmath32 and @xmath33 , it intersects every @xmath50-fiber of @xmath49 .",
    "moreover , this @xmath146-leaf must intersect every @xmath50-fiber with only finitely many points , which comes from it is a compact and complete submanifold .",
    "if this compact @xmath146-leaf is not periodic by @xmath0 , then theorem 1.9 of @xcite shows that @xmath0 is semi - conjugated to @xmath41 times an irrational rotation on @xmath50 , this implies @xmath0 has no periodic points .",
    "this contradicts to @xmath148 and @xmath149 are two fixed points of @xmath0 , thus @xmath0 must have a periodic compact @xmath146-leaf @xmath150 .    from the periodicity of @xmath150 , we know that @xmath151 only contains @xmath148 or @xmath149 , and @xmath152 . assuming @xmath153 , then from theorem 1.7 of @xcite , we have @xmath154 in particularly , @xmath155 and @xmath156 has strong homoclinic intersections .",
    "recall that from the construction of @xmath0 , @xmath157_u\\times\\ss^1=\\{0_s\\}\\times[-1,1]_u\\times\\{0\\}.\\ ] ] since @xmath158 and @xmath103 is very small(remark [ rem : small ] ) , property 3 of proposition [ prop : property ] implies for every @xmath159_u\\times\\ss^1 $ ] , we have @xmath160 . on the other hand , from property 4 of proposition [ prop : property ] , for every @xmath161 , we know that @xmath162 and hence @xmath163 .",

    "the same argument works for @xmath169 , thus @xmath0 must be accessible .      from the proof of last lemma , we know that @xmath170 $ ] and @xmath171 $ ] .",
    "so we can define two disjoint compact @xmath0-invariant @xmath172-saturated sets @xmath173,\\qquad i=0,1.\\ ] ] notice that @xmath174 intersects every center leaf .",

    "moreover , there exists some point @xmath181 , such that @xmath182 , and the center interval @xmath183 does not intersect @xmath184 .    however , there exists some @xmath185 , such that the point @xmath186 , and @xmath187 . from the invariance of @xmath184 and @xmath188 , and @xmath0 preserves",
    "the orientation of @xmath50-fiber , for every @xmath5 , the center curve started from @xmath189 will meet @xmath190 , and the center interval @xmath191 does not intersect @xmath188 .",
    "this is a contradiction for @xmath192 .",
    "this proves @xmath0 is not transitive .    actually , the same idea we can prove the following generalized statement .",
    "let @xmath145 be a partially hyperbolic skew - product diffeomorphism . if @xmath0 preserves the orientation of center foliation , and has two disjoint invariant compact @xmath172-saturated sets , then @xmath0 is not transitive . in",
    "particularly , if @xmath0 is transitive , then it has only one minimal @xmath172-saturated . in a similar spirit",
    ", @xcite shows that every partially hyperbolic diffeomorphism on the nonabelian 3-nilmanifolds has only one minimal @xmath172-saturated set .",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> in this paper , we construct a partially hyperbolic skew - product diffeomorphism @xmath0 on @xmath1 , such that @xmath0 is accessible and chain transitive , but not transitive . </S>"
  ]
}
